Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Learn to make a contribution to your business or office

The Applied Associates in Administrative Assistant/Office Manager is designed to give students the skills necessary to immediately make a difference in the workplace. Students will develop office skills including: teamwork, information processing, communication, records management, customer service ethics, and more. Students will also learn how to use spreadsheets and databases to solve business problems, as well as the basic accounting processes businesses use.

How long will this program take?

Our online degree program allows students the flexibility to finish their degree while balancing a busy life. Students can accelerate to graduation by taking classes all three semesters each year, or take a semester off when needed. Students must complete the program within four years.

What will I study?

Students will participate in the following areas of study:

  • General Accounting
  • Office Procedures
  • Applications for Business (spreadsheets, database applications, etc.)
  • Human Resource Management

View all degree requirements in the University Catalog and check course availability.

Is an online degree a good fit for me?

Where do I begin?

Students who meet the admission requirements can apply to be directly admitted into a online degree program. These students will start by taking the online orientation course, a one credit course offered every block. This course prepares students to succeed online and charts a course to graduation. Pathway students who complete Academic Start do not need to take GS 111.
